definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
key (on a piano or computer keyboard)/button (on a mouse or other device)/chemical bond/linchpin

sentences.english: And on these keys the music that you can make is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用那些有限的琴鍵創作出無限的音樂。

sentences.english: The teacher hit the key and began to sing.
sentences.chinese: 老師敲打着琴鍵開始唱歌。

sentences.english: His nails resemble the ivory keys of the spinet.
sentences.chinese: 他的指甲象白色的琴鍵一樣。

sentences.english: A piano has black keys and white keys.
This pianist’s long fingers help him reach all the keys on the keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 這個鋼琴家的長手指讓他能夠夠及鍵盤上的所有琴鍵。

sentences.english: Little notes are wonderful; they turn keys into painting brush.
sentences.chinese: 小小音符真是了不起，能讓琴鍵作畫筆。

sentences.english: Youget me up on that gangway and you rill out in front of me a keyboard ofmillions of keys, Millions and billions of keys that never end.
sentences.chinese: 走過跳板，前面的鍵盤有無數的琴鍵。

sentences.english: We do not always play and press down the pedal at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 我們並不總是在同一時間彈下琴鍵和按下踏板的。

sentences.english: And on those keys the music that you can make is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 在那些琴鍵上你能彈奏的音樂是無限的。

sentences.english: Take a piano. The keys begin, the keys end.
sentences.chinese: 拿一部鋼琴來說，從琴鍵開始，又結束。

sentences.english: Sometimes there are only strings and digitals with me.
sentences.chinese: 有時陪伴我的只有琴絃和琴鍵。

sentences.english: Place your fingers on the keys to play CEG.
sentences.chinese: 把手指正確地放置在琴鍵上。

sentences.english: The length of the bars of the xylophone determines the different notes of the scale.
sentences.chinese: 木琴琴鍵的長度決定音階的不同音調。

sentences.english: She tickled the ivories and broke into song.
sentences.chinese: 她彈着琴鍵就唱起了歌。

sentences.english: Sunlight through the window in the pouring of the black and white keys, with patches of traces.
sentences.chinese: 陽光透過窗戶傾瀉在黑白琴鍵上，顯出斑駁的痕跡。

definition: to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
